page.title: 09Farming, Penn and Wycombe.
page.content: {Puttenham Place Farm.}Size:- 650 acres. Crops:- 150 acres winter wheat 150 acres winter barley. Animals:- 100 milk cows. Age:- 500 years old. Buildings:- Cattle yard, silage pit, hay barn, grain store. Machinery:- 1 combine, 3 tractors, corn drills, sprays, fertilizers. Labour force:- 4. Transportation of produce:- lorries. Hours of working:- Summer 7 am - 9 pm. Winter 7 am - 5 pm.{Seagrave Farm}was thought to be the site of Winchmore Hill village. We saw the 800 year old yew tree.{Bottom,Town and Parsonage {farms}are 14th century buildings. {Bottom farm and Parsonage farm}are well cared for homes. The first has stables and 9 acres,the second has been made into a lovely home. At{Town {Farm}a company called Britnells hires out caravans. The farmland which was a council dump is to be a golf course.
